fr.umlv.yourobot.elements

Class Element

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.umlv.yourobot.elements.Element
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Area, Barres, Bonus, Robot, Wall

    public abstract class Element
extends java.lang.Object
    Represent an element. License: GNU Public license v3.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Element

        public Element(TypeElementBase typeElement,
       java.awt.image.BufferedImage texture,
       int x,
       int y)
        A game element.
        Parameters:
        typeElement - Type of the element.
        texture - Texture of the element.
        x - X position of the element.
        y - Y position of the element.

    • Method Detail

      • render

        public void render(java.awt.Graphics2D gd)
        Render the element on the graphic gd. This method simply draw the texture.
        Parameters:
        gd - Graphic to draw on. Note: You can override the position function getX() and getY(). The rendering will be made on the overriden method.

      • render

        protected void render(java.awt.Graphics2D gd,
          java.awt.image.BufferedImage texture)
        Render the element on the graphic gd. This method simply draw the given texture.
        Parameters:
        gd - Graphic to draw on.
        texture - The texture to draw. Note: You can override the position function getX() and getY(). The rendering will be made on the overriden method.

      • setOrientation

        public void setOrientation(int degree)
        Define the orientation of the element to render.
        Parameters:
        degree - Orientation to set in degree.

        Get the orientation of the element.
        Returns:
        The orientation of the element.

      • getX

        public int getX()
        Get the position of the element.
        Returns:
        The actual position of the element.

      • getY

        public int getY()
        Get the position of the element.
        Returns:
        The actual position of the element.

      • setX

        public void setX(int x)
        Force the position. Note: Break all the physics. (Apply a transform, do not use)
        Parameters:
        x - New x.

      • setY

        public void setY(int y)
        Force the position. Note: Break all the physics. (Apply a transform, do not use)
        Parameters:
        y - New y.

      • attachToWorld

        Attach the element with the JBox2D World w.
        Parameters:
        w - JBox2D World.

      • detachFromWorld

        public void detachFromWorld(org.jbox2d.dynamics.World w)
        Remove the body from JBox2D world w.
        Parameters:
        w - JBox2D World

      • getBody

        public org.jbox2d.dynamics.Body getBody()
        Get the body of the superclass.
        Returns:
        The body. Can be null if the element is not registered with a world.

      • getTexture

        protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage getTexture()
        Get the texture of the element.
        Returns:
        The texture of the element.

      • getBodyDef

        protected org.jbox2d.dynamics.BodyDef getBodyDef()
        Get the definition of the body.
        Returns:
        The definition of the body. Note: Once the element is registered, the definition is ignored. Use only inside the constructor.

      • getFixtureDef

        protected org.jbox2d.dynamics.FixtureDef getFixtureDef()
        The fixtureDefinition of the element.
        Returns:
        The fixturedefinition of element. Note: Once the element is registered, the definition is ignored. Use only inside the constructor.
